embeds.title: Smoking Barrel
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit

Whenever you trigger a **Dead On** effect, your next attack deals 3 (4) more damage.

messages.content: I'm allergic to hermit, so I'll leave this to the good players
it isn't bad
but that's my experience with old smoking barrel
idk how good new smoking barrel is
harsh nerf, but its still a better version of inflame for decks based around dead on. This mostly effects cards like headshot and spray N prey that benefit from vigor multiple times.
or the newly buffed Snapshot
or magnum as much as i hate it
dead or alive is also fairly decent with this, and cheat gets you two procs
if I had a nickel for each person that has an extreme hatred for one specific hermit card I've seen, I'd have two nickels
which isn't a lot but it's weird that it happened twice
It used to go hard with the old combo but that definitely won't be a thing now
The change to combo hurts me on the deepest level of my soul
it heals my soul though
because now double combo is no longer OP and boring
i havent played with the new one yet but holy shit im so glad its gone
New combo is just worse Improvising
rushdown problem except at least with a rushdown deck it feels like you built it

well:
-that's a champ card, which will probably get nerfed directly or indirectly
-combo costs less and can proc more times
improvising will always trigger even if you aren't in any of the stances, combo only triggers if you manage to activate dead on effect of a card
improvising makes up for the cost difference in the same turn that you play it
uncommon vs rare though
it makes sense for the rare card to be a bit stronger
I'm well aware
That's why I'm saying new combo is a worse Improvising while the old one was completely unique in its effect
completely unique?
what about dead branch
*insert that one image of a bunch of forks and one "unique" fork that's also wholly unusable as a fork*
seriously though, while the old combo was more unique, two copies of it led to a very guaranteed and very boring win
Dead branch only gives you card if you exhaust them and more importantly can give you any card of a given character while combo only gives you dead on cards so I'd say quite different in its effect
combo is just targeted dead branch with a different "when"
I'm aware that the card wasn't well balanced but I'm still really sad that the creators decided to completely scrap its original effect
Wish there was another way of balancing it
there is the option of "add an echo of a dead on card"
but that's still kinda ehhhh

This is a fantastic card, it helps immensely with offensive scaling and leans into a really fun mechanic for hermit. It's important to note just how many defensive cards have dead on for the hermit (dive, vantage, ghostly presence, scavenge). You can play a bunch of those defensive cards to build up vigor, which you can keep between turns, and then play a big multihit card (spray and pray, headshot, dead or alive,spite) to deal massive burst damage. It also can have great moments with snapshot, which both procs smoking barrel and can really benefit from the vigor to create tons of block on key turns. I am usually very happy to take this, even buying it from stores somewhat often, though it is important that you have a reasonable number of dead on cards and some type of multi hit for it to really shine.

It is a shame about the recent nerf, though the core functionality of the card isn't affected, and I still think it will be a great part of hermit's toolbox. I love that there is a clear desire to keep the hermit balanced, but it does feel like there is too much of a tendency to keep them slightly underpowered through nerfs.
